pageContext.description: Dimensions: L 155mm; WE 62mm; Wbt 23mm,Typology: slight midrib; side flanges along upper part of blade.
pageContext.surface: A little green patina in septum; mainly deteriorated to varied green flaky surface
pageContext.remarks: Circumstances: Label: "Dr. John Evans figures a similar one in his Ancient Bronze Implements of Great Britain (page 80) found in the Severn near Wainlodes Hill, Gloucester. Mrs. Dickinson of Hurst Pierpoint has another and found at Clayton Hill, Sussex. Four others found in making the railway near Bognor one in the Blackmoor Museum, Salisbury. Another found near Brighton is figured in Sussex arch. Collection, Vol. II, 268.,  Found near Ashford in making railway to Hastings.",Labels/Markings: old-style label stuck in septum - slightly faded sepia 11,PRBAF:SI,Ext.: CI,Rec.: SN 31 July 81,Source: Sale Room
